answer: Elephants are connected to Gajabrishta through the construction of temples by the later Cholas of the Chola empire in the Indian subcontinent, especially in the Thondai Mandalam area around North Tamil Nadu. The sanctum sanctorum of these temples, especially Shiva temples, had a style of vimana that resembled the back or hip portion of a sitting elephant, known as Gajabrishta.
